verses.text: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.

similars.text: Therefore was the wrath of the Lord kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.
For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.

Therefore, is the anger of the Lord kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them; and the hills did tremble, and their carcasses were torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

Therefore is the anger of the Lord kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them: and the hills did tremble, and their carcases were torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

And it was so, that after the Lord had spoken these words unto Job, the Lord said to Eliphaz the Temanite, My wrath is kindled against thee, and against thy two friends: for ye have not spoken of me the thing that is right, as my servant Job hath.

verses.text: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

similars.text: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.

And it was so, that after the Lord had spoken these words unto Job, the Lord said to Eliphaz the Temanite, My wrath is kindled against thee, and against thy two friends: for ye have not spoken of me the thing that is right, as my servant Job hath.

Now when Job's three friends heard of all this evil that was come upon him, they came every one from his own place; Eliphaz the Temanite, and Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite: for they had made an appointment together to come to mourn with him and to comfort him.

verses.text: Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they were elder than he.
When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.

similars.text: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

verses.text: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not shew you mine opinion.
I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.
But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.

similars.text: He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
I have even heard of thee, that the spirit of the gods is in thee, and that light and understanding and excellent wisdom is found in thee.
For what man knoweth the things of a man, save the spirit of man which is in him? even so the things of God knoweth no man, but the Spirit of God.
And it came to pass that as he read, he was filled with the Spirit of the Lord.
And he hath filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship;

verses.text: Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.
Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.

similars.text: I said, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.
I said, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.
Therefore, follow me, and listen to the counsel which I shall give unto you.

verses.text: Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.
Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced Job, or that answered his words:
Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.

similars.text: Thus saith the Lord, Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the mighty man glory in his might, let not the rich man glory in his riches:
If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.
That your faith should not stand in the wisdom of men, but in the power of God.
For after that in the wisdom of God the world by wisdom knew not God, it pleased God by the foolishness of preaching to save them that believe.
Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?
O Lord, I know that the way of man is not in himself: it is not in man that walketh to direct his steps.

verses.text: Now he hath not directed his words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.
They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.
When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more;)
I said, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.

similars.text: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.
And he answered and said unto them, I will also ask you one thing; and answer me:
Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.

verses.text: For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.

similars.text: Behold, my soul is rent with anguish because of you, and my heart is pained; I fear lest ye shall be cast off forever. Behold, I am full of the Spirit of God, insomuch that my frame has no strength.
Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed within me; my heart within me is desolate.
When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.

verses.text: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.
I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.

similars.text: That I may come unto you with joy by the will of God, and may with you be refreshed.
And for me, that utterance may be given unto me, that I may open my mouth boldly, to make known the mystery of the gospel,

verses.text: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man's person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.
For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing my maker would soon take me away.
